titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Henri Peyre Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by John Espy and staff of Manuscipts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:51

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The Henri M. Peyre Collection consists of a single volume presented to Professor Peyre on the occasion of his eightieth birthday. The volume contains photostatic copies of almost 350 letters from former Yale students, written in 1980 and 1981, with a foreword by Georges May.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Carl Bandelin, 1984; Westport Public Library, 2003.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research, with the exception of gradebooks in accession 2004-M-016, which will be closed until January 1, 2049.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Henri Peyre Collection (MS 1395). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Henri M. Peyre Collection consists of a single volume presented to Professor Peyre on the occasion of his eightieth birthday. The volume contains photostatic copies of almost 350 letters from former Yale students, written in 1980 and 1981, with a foreword by Georges May.
The volume was donated to the Yale Library by Carl Bandelin on September 12, 1984.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Henri Maurice Peyre was born in Paris, February 21, 1901. After coming to the United States in 1925, he served on the Yale University faculty for thirty-five years, including twenty-five years as chairman of the Department of French. Peyre died in December 1988.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Bound volume of letters from former Yale students

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Much of this accession is arranged as received. Whenever possible, original folder titles were used.

did.unittitle: Honorary Doctor of Letters degree from the State University of New York
Membership certificate for the American Academy of Arts and Sciences
Journal of menus and seating plans for dinners with family and friends
Lock of hair, money order receipt, course schedule for Marco McCormick
Pen holder [inscribed Hommage au Professeur Henri Peyre, Le 20 Mars 1966, L'Union Saint Jean-Baptiste D'Amérique]
Athéisme, histoire des religions, esclavage, péché originel
Draper, Theodore, "The Idea of the 'Cold War' and Its Prophets"
Grossman, Kathryn, The Early Novels of Victor Hugo: Towards a Poetics of Harmony
Haft, Cynthia, "The 'Thematic' Criticism of Jean-Paul Weber"
La Nuit dans les Nuits (One Thousand and One Nights), May, Georges
Szogyi, Alex, "Truth-Telling and Truth Suggesting in Molière's Theatre"
Peyre, Henri and Diana Festa McCormick, book reviews
Unidentified poem, possibly by Sergio McCormick
Negatives, Mcormick, Hélène and Alex Szogyi

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 3 of Accession 2004-M-016 is closed until January 1, 2049 as established by Yale Corporation regulations.
